article: Waking Up at 3 AM: What Does it Mean?
intro: You sit upright in bed, eyes wide open. You look over at the clock—it’s only 3 AM! Why on earth have you woken up, and better yet, why do you feel so alert? Believe it or not, this early morning hour is among the most sacred spiritual hours. But what does waking up at 3 AM mean exactly, why is it so significant, and what should you do about it? Keep reading to find out.

points.name: Waking Up at 3 AM Spiritual Meanings

steps.title: In Chinese medicine, waking up at 3 AM is a sign of illness.
steps.subtitle: The Chinese pay close attention to dates, times, and locations in their traditional practices. According to ancient tradition and lore, each organ has a 2-hour activity period per day, and the lungs and liver inhabit the 3 AM slot. Waking up suddenly at 3 AM may indicate that your lungs or liver are irritated.
sub-points: Did you wake up with a cough or aching chest? This could indicate a cold, lung infection, or allergies.
Do you have stomach pain or itchy skin? Perhaps there’s something amiss with your liver.
Keep in mind that this diagnosis practice is all circumstantial and relies on superstition. Contact a doctor if you suspect anything is wrong with your health.

steps.title: The Law of Attraction says you’re closest to your love at 3 AM.
steps.subtitle: You and your true love’s souls may be the most connected when the spirit and physical worlds merge during the Witching Hour. If you suddenly wake up at 3 AM, chances are your twin flame, soulmate, or significant other has woken up too.
sub-points: You don’t necessarily have to be in a relationship for this to happen. Who knows? Your future partner may be waking up just as confused as you are!

points.name: What to Do When You Wake Up at 3 AM
Can stress wake you up at night?

steps.title: Yes, waking up at 3 AM could be a sign that you’re stressed or anxious.
steps.subtitle: The leading causes of waking up at 3 AM are depression and anxiety, so if that sounds like it might be you, it might be worth looking into. Perhaps you’re experiencing sleep insomnia (the inability to fall and stay asleep), or anxious midnight thoughts are pulling you from slumber. Many believe that the spirit world is closest to the physical world at 3 AM, amplifying the energies around you. Because of this, normal feelings of stress, grief, or worry can amplify and cause you to wake from even the deepest slumber.
sub-points: If you wake up feeling anxious,  by taking a calming deep breath in and out. Focus on what you can see, hear, smell, taste, and touch to bring yourself back to the present moment.
Consider talking to a therapist or counselor if you’re struggling to sleep. Online resources like  and  can help you find care without leaving home.

points.name: Why do I wake up at the same time each night?

steps.title: Scientifically, you get up at the same time because of circadian rhythm.
steps.subtitle: Your circadian rhythm is your internal clock, prompting you to sleep and wake throughout the day and night. This clock governs your sleep routine, and waking up at the same time each night may occur if your sleep patterns are naturally shorter.
sub-points: by adjusting your sleeping habits. Avoid big meals right before bed, exercise throughout the day, and skip your midday nap.
Talk to your doctor if you experience anxiety, depression, or insomnia. While waking up at the same time each night is normal, experiencing these symptoms isn't.
